description: Understanding the physical laws that govern the universe.

slides.title: What is Astrophysics?
slides.content:
# Physics of the Cosmos üåå

Applying laws of physics (gravity, thermodynamics, quantum mechanics) to understand astronomical objects.

Astronomers ask "What is it?"
Astrophysicists ask "How does it work?"

slides.title: Gravity
slides.content:
# The Master Force üçé

- Newton: Force between masses.
- Einstein (**General Relativity**): Curvature of spacetime.
- Dominates at large scales.
- Holds planets, stars, and galaxies together.

slides.title: Electromagnetic Radiation
slides.content:
# Light üí°

Our main source of info.
- From Gamma rays (high energy) to Radio waves (low energy).
- **Blackbody Radiation**: Hotter objects emit bluer, more intense light.

slides.title: Special Relativity
slides.content:
# Speed Limit üö¶

Einstein (1905).
1. Speed of light ($c$) is constant.
2. **Time Dilation**: Moving clocks run slow.
3. **$E=mc^2$**: Mass and Energy are interchangeable.

slides.title: General Relativity
slides.content:
# Space-Time Fabric üï∏Ô∏è

Einstein (1915).
- Mass warps space-time.
- "Matter tells space how to curve; Space tells matter how to move."
- Predicted Black Holes and Gravitational Lensing.

slides.title: Relativity Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: According to General Relativity, what is Gravity?

slides.title: Black Hole Physics
slides.content:
# Event Horizon üï≥Ô∏è

- **Schwarzschild Radius**: Radius where escape velocity = $c$.
- **Spaghettification**: Tidal forces stretch you into a noodle near the center.
- Time stops at the edge (relative to outside).

slides.title: Gravitational Waves
slides.content:
# Ripples in Pond „Ä∞Ô∏è

Violent events (colliding black holes) cause ripples in spacetime itself.
- Detected by **LIGO** (2015).
- Like "hearing" the universe for the first time.

slides.title: Neutrinos
slides.content:
# Ghost Particles üëª

- Tiny mass, no charge.
- Pass through Earth (and you) by the trillions.
- Born in fusion (Sun) and supernovae.
- Hard to detect (IceCube detector in Antarctica).

slides.title: Cosmic Rays
slides.content:
# Bullets from Space üî´

High energy protons/nuclei traveling near light speed.
- From Supernovae and Black Holes.
- Atmosphere protects us (creates Carbon-14 and mutations).

slides.title: Plasma Physics
slides.content:
# The 4th State ‚ö°

- 99% of visible universe is plasma (Stars, ISM).
- Ionized gas (electrons stripped).
- Controlled by Magnetic Fields (**Magnetohydrodynamics**).

slides.title: Dark Matter Evidence
slides.content:
# Rotation Curves üåÄ

Vera Rubin noticed outer stars in galaxies orbit as fast as inner ones.
- Expected: Slower (Kepler).
- Implied invisible mass halo.

slides.title: Accretion Disks
slides.content:
# Feeding Time üçΩÔ∏è

Gas spiraling into a compact object (Black Hole/Star).
- Friction heats it to millions of degrees.
- Emits X-rays.
- Method to "see" black holes.

slides.title: Jets
slides.content:
# Cosmic Beams üî¶

Matter ejected from poles of accreting objects at near light speed.
- Powered by magnetic fields twisting up.
- Can span hundreds of thousands of light years.

slides.title: Gamma Ray Bursts
slides.content:
# Biggest Bangs üí•

Short, intense flashes of Gamma rays.
- Most energetic events since Big Bang.
- Likely from black hole birth or neutron star collision.
- Could sterilize a galaxy nearby.

slides.title: Standard Model
slides.content:
# Particle Zoo ü¶Å

Physics of the very small.
- Quarks, Leptons, Bosons.
- Astrophysics tests these limits (e.g., dense neutron stars).

slides.title: Inflation Theory
slides.content:
# The Bang's Bang üê°

Universe expanded exponentially ($10^{26}$x) in fraction of a second ($10^{-35}$ s).
- Explains why universe looks smooth and flat.
- Quantum fluctuations stretched to become seeds of galaxies.

slides.title: Astrophysics Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Relativity** governs the heavy/fast.
- **Quantum Mechanics** governs the small.
- **Gravity** rules structure.
- Extreme objects (Black Holes) test our physics to the breaking point.
